meanings.definition: To burn or scorch with hot liquid or steam.
meanings.sent1: Be careful not to scaud yourself when pouring the hot soup.
meanings.sent2: The chef accidentally scauded his hand while cooking pasta.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy waiter managed to scaud himself with the coffee pot.
meanings.sent4: The steam from the kettle seemed to scaud the air itself.
meanings.sent5: The boiling water bubbled fiercely, ready to scaud anything in its path.

meanings.definition: A burn or injury caused by hot liquid or steam.
meanings.sent1: She had to treat the scaud on her arm with ointment.
meanings.sent2: The scaud on his foot was painful but healing slowly.
meanings.sent3: The kitchen worker wore gloves to avoid getting a scaud.
meanings.sent4: The little girl cried out in pain from the scaud on her hand.
meanings.sent5: The doctor bandaged the scaud carefully to prevent infection.
